alert.note: Alert for Pacific; Wahkiakum (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 10:13AM PST until January 07 at 1:07PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon...Washington... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Naselle River near Naselle affecting Pacific and Wahkiakum Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Naselle River near Naselle. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Above 17.0 feet, expect major flooding in Naselle with numerous homes completely surrounded by flood waters and a several structures flooded. Numerous roads are flooded with deep and swiftly moving water, including State Route 4. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM PST Thursday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 16.9 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM PST.
